title.text: RFC 4765: The Intrusion Detection Message Exchange Format (IDMEF)

contents.text:
Network Working Group                                           H. Debar
Request for Comments: 4765                                France Telecom
Category: Experimental                                          D. Curry
                                                                Guardian
                                                            B. Feinstein
                                                       SecureWorks, Inc.
                                                              March 2007
The Intrusion Detection Message Exchange Format (IDMEF)
contents.zh-CHS: 入侵检测消息交换格式（IDMEF）

contents.text: Status of This Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 关于下段备忘

contents.text: This memo defines an Experimental Protocol for the Internet community. It does not specify an Internet standard of any kind. Discussion and suggestions for improvement are requested. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 这份备忘录为互联网社区定义了一个实验性协议。它没有规定任何类型的互联网标准。要求进行讨论并提出改进建议。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: IESG Note
contents.zh-CHS: IESG注释

contents.text: The content of this RFC was at one time considered by the IETF, but the working group concluded before this work was approved as a standards-track protocol. This RFC is not a candidate for any level of Internet Standard. The IETF disclaims any knowledge of the fitness of this RFC for any purpose and in particular notes that the decision to publish is not based on complete IETF review for such things as security, congestion control, or inappropriate interaction with deployed protocols. The IESG has chosen to publish this document in order to document the work as it was when the working group concluded and to encourage experimentation and development of the technology. Readers of this RFC should exercise caution in evaluating its value for implementation and deployment.
contents.zh-CHS: IETF曾一度审议过该RFC的内容，但工作组在该工作被批准为标准跟踪协议之前结束了该工作。本RFC不适用于任何级别的互联网标准。IETF不承认本RFC适用于任何目的的任何知识，特别注意到，发布决定并非基于IETF对安全、拥塞控制或与已部署协议的不当交互等事项的全面审查。IESG选择出版本文件，以记录工作组结束时的工作，并鼓励试验和开发该技术。本RFC的读者应谨慎评估其实施和部署价值。

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: The purpose of the Intrusion Detection Message Exchange Format (IDMEF) is to define data formats and exchange procedures for sharing information of interest to intrusion detection and response systems and to the management systems that may need to interact with them.
contents.zh-CHS: 入侵检测消息交换格式（IDMEF）的目的是定义数据格式和交换程序，以共享入侵检测和响应系统以及可能需要与之交互的管理系统感兴趣的信息。

contents.text: This document describes a data model to represent information exported by intrusion detection systems and explains the rationale for using this model. An implementation of the data model in the Extensible Markup Language (XML) is presented, an XML Document Type Definition is developed, and examples are provided.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档描述了一个表示入侵检测系统导出的信息的数据模型，并解释了使用该模型的基本原理。介绍了该数据模型在可扩展标记语言（XML）中的实现，开发了XML文档类型定义，并给出了示例。

contents.text: Table of Contents
contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: The Intrusion Detection Message Exchange Format (IDMEF) [2] is intended to be a standard data format that automated intrusion detection systems can use to report alerts about events that they deem suspicious. The development of this standard format will enable interoperability among commercial, open source, and research systems, allowing users to mix-and-match the deployment of these systems according to their strong and weak points to obtain an optimal implementation.
contents.zh-CHS: 入侵检测消息交换格式（IDMEF）[2]是一种标准数据格式，自动化入侵检测系统可以使用它来报告有关其认为可疑的事件的警报。此标准格式的开发将实现商业、开源和研究系统之间的互操作性，允许用户根据其优缺点混合和匹配这些系统的部署，以获得最佳实现。

contents.text: The most obvious place to implement the IDMEF is in the data channel between an intrusion detection analyzer (or "sensor") and the manager (or "console") to which it sends alarms. But there are other places where the IDMEF can be useful:
contents.zh-CHS: 实现IDMEF最明显的地方是入侵检测分析仪（或“传感器”）和管理器（或“控制台”）之间的数据通道，它向管理器（或“控制台”）发送警报。但IDMEF在其他地方也很有用：

contents.text: o a single database system that could store the results from a variety of intrusion detection products would make it possible for data analysis and reporting activities to be performed on "the whole picture" instead of just a part of it;
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个能够存储各种入侵检测产品结果的单一数据库系统将使数据分析和报告活动能够在“整个画面”上进行，而不仅仅是其中的一部分；

contents.text: o an event correlation system that could accept alerts from a variety of intrusion detection products would be capable of performing more sophisticated cross-correlation and cross-confirmation calculations than one that is limited to a single product;
contents.zh-CHS: o 可以接受来自各种入侵检测产品的警报的事件关联系统将能够执行比仅限于单个产品的系统更复杂的互关联和互确认计算；

contents.text: o a graphical user interface that could display alerts from a variety of intrusion detection products would enable the user to monitor all of the products from a single screen, and require him or her to learn only one interface, instead of several; and
contents.zh-CHS: o 可显示各种入侵检测产品警报的图形用户界面将使用户能够从单个屏幕监控所有产品，并要求用户只学习一个界面，而不是几个界面；和

contents.text: o a common data exchange format would make it easier for different organizations (users, vendors, response teams, law enforcement) to not only exchange data, but also communicate about it.
contents.zh-CHS: o 一种通用的数据交换格式将使不同的组织（用户、供应商、响应团队、执法部门）不仅可以更轻松地交换数据，还可以就数据进行交流。

contents.text: The diversity of uses for the IDMEF needs to be considered when selecting its method of implementation.
contents.zh-CHS: 在选择IDMEF的实施方法时，需要考虑其用途的多样性。

contents.text: 1.1. About the IDMEF Data Model
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1. 关于IDMEF数据模型

contents.text: The IDMEF data model is an object-oriented representation of the alert data sent to intrusion detection managers by intrusion detection analyzers.
contents.zh-CHS: IDMEF数据模型是入侵检测分析器发送给入侵检测管理器的警报数据的面向对象表示。

contents.text: 1.1.1. Problems Addressed by the Data Model
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1.1. 数据模型解决的问题

contents.text: The data model addresses several problems associated with representing intrusion detection alert data:
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型解决了与表示入侵检测警报数据相关的几个问题：

contents.text: o Alert information is inherently heterogeneous. Some alerts are defined with very little information, such as origin, destination, name, and time of the event. Other alerts provide much more information, such as ports or services, processes, user information, and so on. The data model that represents this information must be flexible to accommodate different needs.
contents.zh-CHS: o 警报信息本质上是异构的。某些警报的定义信息非常少，例如事件的来源、目的地、名称和时间。其他警报提供更多信息，如端口或服务、进程、用户信息等。表示此信息的数据模型必须灵活，以适应不同的需求。

contents.text: An object-oriented model is naturally extensible via aggregation and subclassing. If an implementation of the data model extends it with new classes, either by aggregation or subclassing, an implementation that does not understand these extensions will still be able to understand the subset of information that is defined by the data model. Subclassing and aggregation provide extensibility while preserving the consistency of the model.
contents.zh-CHS: 面向对象的模型自然可以通过聚合和子类化进行扩展。如果数据模型的实现通过聚合或子类化使用新类对其进行扩展，那么不理解这些扩展的实现仍然能够理解数据模型定义的信息子集。子类化和聚合提供了可扩展性，同时保持了模型的一致性。

contents.text: o Intrusion detection environments are different. Some analyzers detect attacks by analyzing network traffic; others use operating system logs or application audit trail information. Alerts for the same attack, sent by analyzers with different information sources, will not contain the same information.
contents.zh-CHS: o 入侵检测环境是不同的。一些分析器通过分析网络流量来检测攻击；其他人使用操作系统日志或应用程序审计跟踪信息。由具有不同信息源的分析器发送的相同攻击的警报将不包含相同的信息。

contents.text: The data model defines support classes that accommodate the differences in data sources among analyzers. In particular, the notions of source and target for the alert are represented by the combination of Node, Process, Service, and User classes.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型定义了支持类，以适应分析器之间数据源的差异。特别是，警报的源和目标概念由节点、进程、服务和用户类的组合表示。

contents.text: o Analyzer capabilities are different. Depending on the environment, one may install a lightweight analyzer that provides little information in its alerts, or a more complex analyzer that will have a greater impact on the running system but provide more detailed alert information. The data model must allow for conversion to formats used by tools other than intrusion detection analyzers, for the purpose of further processing the alert information.
contents.zh-CHS: o 分析器的功能是不同的。根据环境的不同，可以安装在警报中提供很少信息的轻型分析器，也可以安装对正在运行的系统有较大影响但提供更详细警报信息的更复杂分析器。为了进一步处理警报信息，数据模型必须允许转换为入侵检测分析仪以外的工具使用的格式。

contents.text: The data model defines extensions to the basic Document Type Definition (DTD) that allow carrying both simple and complex alerts. Extensions are accomplished through subclassing or association of new classes.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型定义了对基本文档类型定义（DTD）的扩展，允许携带简单和复杂警报。扩展是通过新类的子类化或关联来完成的。

contents.text: o Operating environments are different. Depending on the kind of network or operating system used, attacks will be observed and reported with different characteristics. The data model should accommodate these differences.
contents.zh-CHS: o 操作环境不同。根据所使用的网络或操作系统的类型，将以不同的特征观察和报告攻击。数据模型应该适应这些差异。

contents.text: Significant flexibility in reporting is provided by the Node and Service support classes. If additional information must be reported, subclasses may be defined that extend the data model with additional attributes.
contents.zh-CHS: 节点和服务支持类在报告方面提供了极大的灵活性。如果必须报告附加信息，可以定义子类，用附加属性扩展数据模型。

contents.text: o Commercial vendor objectives are different. For various reasons, vendors may wish to deliver more or less information about certain types of attacks.
contents.zh-CHS: o 商业供应商的目标是不同的。出于各种原因，供应商可能希望提供更多或更少关于某些类型攻击的信息。

contents.text: The object-oriented approach allows this flexibility while the subclassing rules preserve the integrity of the model.
contents.zh-CHS: 面向对象的方法允许这种灵活性，而子类化规则保持了模型的完整性。

contents.text: 1.1.2. Data Model Design Goals
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1.2. 数据模型设计目标

contents.text: The data model was designed to provide a standard representation of alerts in an unambiguous fashion, and to permit the relationship between simple and complex alerts to be described.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型旨在以明确的方式提供警报的标准表示，并允许描述简单警报和复杂警报之间的关系。

contents.text: 1.1.2.1. Representing Events

The goal of the data model is to provide a standard representation of the information that an intrusion detection analyzer reports when it detects an occurrence of some unusual event(s). These alerts may be simple or complex, depending on the capabilities of the analyzer that creates them.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型的目标是提供入侵检测分析器在检测到某些异常事件时报告的信息的标准表示形式。这些警报可能简单，也可能复杂，具体取决于创建它们的分析器的功能。

contents.text: 1.1.2.2. Content-Driven

The design of the data model is content-driven. This means that new objects are introduced to accommodate additional content, not semantic differences between alerts. This is an important goal, as the task of classifying and naming computer vulnerabilities is both extremely difficult and very subjective.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型的设计是内容驱动的。这意味着引入新对象是为了适应额外的内容，而不是警报之间的语义差异。这是一个重要的目标，因为对计算机漏洞进行分类和命名既极其困难，又非常主观。

contents.text: The data model must be unambiguous. This means that while we allow analyzers to be more or less precise than one another (i.e., one analyzer may report more information about an event than another), we do not allow them to produce contradictory information in two alerts describing the same event (i.e., the common subset of information reported by both analyzers must be identical and inserted in the same placeholders within the alert data structure). Of course, it is always possible to insert all "interesting" information about an
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型必须是明确的。这意味着，虽然我们允许分析仪比另一个更精确或更不精确（即，一个分析仪可能会比另一个分析仪报告更多有关事件的信息），但我们不允许它们在描述同一事件的两个警报中产生矛盾的信息（即，两个分析器报告的公共信息子集必须相同，并插入警报数据结构中的相同占位符中）。当然，始终可以插入有关警报的所有“有趣”信息

contents.text: event in extension fields of the alert instead of in the fields where it belongs; however, such practice reduces interoperability and should be avoided whenever possible.
contents.zh-CHS: 警报扩展字段中的事件，而不是警报所属字段中的事件；但是，这种做法会降低互操作性，应尽可能避免。

contents.text: 1.1.2.3. Relationship between Alerts
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1.2.3. 警报之间的关系

contents.text: Intrusion detection alerts can be transmitted at several levels. This document applies to the entire range, from very simple alerts (e.g., those alerts that are the result of a single action or operation in the system, such as a failed login report) to very complex ones (e.g., the aggregation of several events causing an alert to be generated).
contents.zh-CHS: 入侵检测警报可以在多个级别传输。本文档适用于整个范围，从非常简单的警报（例如，系统中单个操作或操作的结果，如失败的登录报告）到非常复杂的警报（例如，导致生成警报的多个事件的聚合）。

contents.text: As such, the data model must provide a way for complex alerts that aggregate several simple alerts to identify those simple alerts in the complex alert's content.
contents.zh-CHS: 因此，数据模型必须为复杂警报提供一种方法，将多个简单警报聚合在一起，以识别复杂警报内容中的那些简单警报。

contents.text: 1.2. About the IDMEF XML Implementation
contents.zh-CHS: 1.2. 关于IDMEF XML实现

contents.text: Two implementations of the IDMEF were originally proposed to the Intrusion Detection Working Group (IDWG): one using the Structure of Management Information (SMI) to describe a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) MIB, and the other using a DTD to describe XML documents.
contents.zh-CHS: IDMEF的两个实现最初向入侵检测工作组（IDWG）提出：一个使用管理信息结构（SMI）来描述简单网络管理协议（SNMP）MIB，另一个使用DTD来描述XML文档。

contents.text: These proposed implementations were reviewed by the IDWG at its September 1999 and February 2000 meetings; it was decided at the February meeting that the XML solution was best at fulfilling the IDWG requirements.
contents.zh-CHS: IDWG在1999年9月和2000年2月的会议上审查了这些拟议的实施方案；在2月份的会议上决定，XML解决方案最适合满足IDWG需求。

contents.text: 1.2.1. The Extensible Markup Language
contents.zh-CHS: 1.2.1. 可扩展标记语言

contents.text: The Extensible Markup Language (XML) [3] is a simplified version of the Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML), a syntax for specifying text markup defined by the ISO 8879 standard. XML is gaining widespread attention as a language for representing and exchanging documents and data on the Internet, and as the solution to most of the problems inherent in HyperText Markup Language (HTML). XML was published as a recommendation by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) on February 10, 1998.
contents.zh-CHS: 可扩展标记语言（XML）[3]是标准通用标记语言（SGML）的简化版本，SGML是一种用于指定ISO 8879标准定义的文本标记的语法。XML作为一种在Internet上表示和交换文档和数据的语言，以及作为解决超文本标记语言（HTML）所固有的大多数问题的解决方案，正受到广泛关注。XML是由万维网联盟（W3C）于1998年2月10日推荐发布的。

contents.text: XML is a metalanguage -- a language for describing other languages -- that enables an application to define its own markup. XML allows the definition of customized markup languages for different types of documents and different applications. This differs from HTML, in which there is a fixed set of identifiers with preset meanings that must be "adapted" for specialized uses. Both XML and HTML use elements (tags) (identifiers delimited by '<' and '>') and attributes
contents.zh-CHS: XML是一种元语言——一种描述其他语言的语言——它使应用程序能够定义自己的标记。XML允许为不同类型的文档和不同的应用程序定义自定义标记语言。这与HTML不同，HTML中有一组具有预设含义的固定标识符，必须“调整”以用于特定用途。XML和HTML都使用元素（标记）（由“<”和“>”分隔的标识符）和属性

contents.text:
(of the form "name='value'"). But where "

" always means "paragraph" in HTML, it may mean "paragraph", "person", "price", or "platypus" in XML, or it might have no meaning at all, depending on the particular application.
contents.zh-CHS:
（形式为“name='value'”。但是，如果在HTML中“

”始终表示“段落”，那么它在XML中可能表示“段落”、“人员”、“价格”或“鸭嘴兽”，或者它可能根本没有任何意义，具体取决于特定的应用程序。

contents.text: NOTE: XML provides both a syntax for declaring document markup and structure (i.e., defining elements and attributes, specifying the order in which they appear, and so on) and a syntax for using that markup in documents. Because markup declarations look radically different from markup, many people are confused as to which syntax is called XML. The answer is that they both are, because they are actually both part of the same language.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：XML提供了一种用于声明文档标记和结构的语法（即定义元素和属性，指定它们出现的顺序，等等），以及一种用于在文档中使用该标记的语法。因为标记声明看起来与标记完全不同，所以许多人对哪种语法称为XML感到困惑。答案是它们都是，因为它们实际上都是同一种语言的一部分。

contents.text: For clarity in this document, we will use the terms "XML" and "XML documents" when speaking in the general case, and the term "IDMEF markup" when speaking specifically of the elements (tags) and attributes that describe IDMEF messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了在本文档中保持清晰，在一般情况下，我们将使用术语“XML”和“XML文档”，在具体谈到描述IDMEF消息的元素（标记）和属性时，将使用术语“IDMEF标记”。

contents.text: The publication of XML was followed by the publication of a second recommendation [4] by the World Wide Web Consortium, defining the use of namespaces in XML documents. An XML namespace is a collection of names, identified by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) [5]. When using namespaces, each tag is identified with the namespace it comes from, allowing tags from different namespaces with the same names to occur in the same document. For example, a single document could contain both "usa:football" and "europe:football" tags, each with different meanings.
contents.zh-CHS: XML发布之后，万维网联盟发布了第二条建议[4]，定义了XML文档中名称空间的使用。XML名称空间是由统一资源标识符（URI）标识的名称集合[5]。当使用名称空间时，每个标记都用它所来自的名称空间来标识，从而允许来自不同名称空间且具有相同名称的标记出现在同一文档中。例如，一个文档可以同时包含“usa:football”和“europe:football”标签，每个标签都有不同的含义。

contents.text: In anticipation of the widespread use of XML namespaces, this memo includes the definition of the URI to be used to identify the IDMEF namespace.
contents.zh-CHS: 鉴于XML名称空间的广泛使用，本备忘录包含了用于标识IDMEF名称空间的URI的定义。

contents.text: 1.2.2. Rationale for Implementing IDMEF in XML
contents.zh-CHS: 1.2.2. 在XML中实现IDMEF的基本原理

contents.text: XML-based applications are being used or developed for a wide variety of purposes, including electronic data interchange in a variety of fields, financial data interchange, electronic business cards, calendar and scheduling, enterprise software distribution, web "push" technology, and markup languages for chemistry, mathematics, music, molecular dynamics, astronomy, book and periodical publishing, web publishing, weather observations, real estate transactions, and many others.
contents.zh-CHS: 基于XML的应用程序正在被广泛地用于或开发，包括各种领域的电子数据交换、金融数据交换、电子名片、日历和日程安排、企业软件分发、web“推送”技术以及用于化学、数学、音乐的标记语言，分子动力学，天文学，书籍和期刊出版，网络出版，天气观测，房地产交易，以及许多其他。

contents.text: XML's flexibility makes it a good choice for these applications; that same flexibility makes it a good choice for implementing the IDMEF as well. Other, more specific reasons for choosing XML to implement the IDMEF are:
contents.zh-CHS: XML的灵活性使其成为这些应用程序的良好选择；同样的灵活性也使它成为实现IDMEF的好选择。选择XML实现IDMEF的其他更具体的原因有：

contents.text: o XML allows a custom language to be developed specifically for the purpose of describing intrusion detection alerts. It also defines a standard way to extend this language, either for later revisions of this document ("standard" extensions) or for vendor-specific use ("non-standard" extensions).
contents.zh-CHS: o XML允许专门为描述入侵检测警报而开发自定义语言。它还定义了扩展该语言的标准方法，用于本文档的后续修订（“标准”扩展）或供应商特定用途（“非标准”扩展）。

contents.text: o Software tools for processing XML documents are widely available, in both commercial and open source forms. Numerous tools and APIs for parsing and/or validating XML are available in a variety of languages, including Java, C, C++, Tcl, Perl, Python, and GNU Emacs Lisp. Widespread access to tools will make adoption of the IDMEF by product developers easier, and hopefully, faster.
contents.zh-CHS: o 处理XML文档的软件工具在商业和开源形式中都广泛可用。用于解析和/或验证XML的许多工具和API可用多种语言，包括java、C++、TCL、Perl、Python和GNU Emacs Lisp。工具的广泛使用将使产品开发人员更容易、更快速地采用IDMEF。

contents.text: o XML meets IDMEF Requirement 5.1 [2], that message formats support full internationalization and localization. The XML standard requires support for both the UTF-8 and UTF-16 encodings of ISO/ IEC 10646 (Universal Multiple-Octet Coded Character Set, "UCS") and Unicode, making all XML applications (and therefore all IDMEF-compliant applications) compatible with these common character encodings.
contents.zh-CHS: o XML满足IDMEF要求5.1[2]，即消息格式支持完全国际化和本地化。XML标准要求同时支持ISO/IEC 10646（通用多八位编码字符集，“UCS”）和Unicode的UTF-8和UTF-16编码，使所有XML应用程序（因此所有符合IDMEF的应用程序）与这些通用字符编码兼容。

contents.text: XML also provides support for specifying, on a per-element basis, the language in which the element's content is written, making IDMEF easy to adapt to "Natural Language Support" versions of a product.
contents.zh-CHS: XML还支持在每个元素的基础上指定用于编写元素内容的语言，使IDMEF易于适应产品的“自然语言支持”版本。

contents.text: o XML meets IDMEF Requirement 5.2 [2], that message formats must support filtering and aggregation. XML's integration with XSL, a style language, allows messages to be combined, discarded, and rearranged.
contents.zh-CHS: o XML满足IDMEF要求5.2[2]，即消息格式必须支持过滤和聚合。XML与XSL（一种风格语言）的集成允许合并、丢弃和重新排列消息。

contents.text: o Ongoing XML development projects, in the W3C and elsewhere, will provide object-oriented extensions, database support, and other useful features. If implemented in XML, the IDMEF immediately gains these features as well.
contents.zh-CHS: o W3C和其他地方正在进行的XML开发项目将提供面向对象的扩展、数据库支持和其他有用的特性。如果用XML实现，IDMEF也会立即获得这些特性。

contents.text: o XML is free, with no license, no license fees, and no royalties.
contents.zh-CHS: o XML是免费的，没有许可证，没有许可费，也没有版税。

contents.text: 2. Notices and Conventions Used in This Document
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 本文件中使用的通知和约定

contents.text: The keywords "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119 [1].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中的关键词“必须”、“不得”、“要求”、“应”、“不得”、“应”、“不应”、“建议”、“可”和“可选”应按照RFC 2119[1]中所述进行解释。

contents.text: An "IDMEF-compliant application" is a program or program component, such as an analyzer or manager, that reads and/or writes messages in the format specified by this memo.
contents.zh-CHS: “IDMEF兼容应用程序”是一个程序或程序组件，如分析器或管理器，它以本备忘录指定的格式读取和/或写入消息。

contents.text: An "IDMEF document" is a message that adheres to the requirements specified by this memo and that is exchanged by two or more IDMEF applications. "IDMEF message" is another term for an "IDMEF document".
contents.zh-CHS: “IDMEF文件”是符合本备忘录规定要求的信息，由两个或多个IDMEF应用程序交换。“IDMEF消息”是“IDMEF文档”的另一个术语。

contents.text: 3. Notational Conventions and Formatting Issues
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 符号约定和格式问题

contents.text: This document uses three notations: Unified Modeling Language to describe the data model [14], XML to describe the markup used in IDMEF documents, and IDMEF markup to represent the documents themselves.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档使用三种符号：统一建模语言来描述数据模型[14]，XML来描述IDMEF文档中使用的标记，以及IDMEF标记来表示文档本身。

contents.text: 3.1. IDMEF XML Documents
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1. IDMEF XML文档

contents.text: This section describes IDMEF XML document formatting rules. Most of these rules are "inherited" from the rules for formatting XML documents.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节介绍IDMEF XML文档格式规则。这些规则中的大多数是从格式化XML文档的规则中“继承”来的。

contents.text: 3.1.1. The Document Prolog
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.1. 文档序言

contents.text: The format of an IDMEF XML document prolog is described in the following sections.
contents.zh-CHS: IDMEF XML文档prolog的格式将在以下部分中描述。

contents.text: 3.1.1.1. XML Declaration
IDMEF documents being exchanged between IDMEF-compliant applications MUST begin with an XML declaration, and MUST specify the XML version in use. Specification of the encoding in use is RECOMMENDED.
contents.zh-CHS: 在符合IDMEF的应用程序之间交换的IDMEF文档必须以XML声明开头，并且必须指定正在使用的XML版本。建议指定正在使用的编码。

contents.text: An IDMEF message SHOULD therefore start with:
contents.zh-CHS: 因此，IDMEF消息应以以下内容开头：

contents.text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<idmef:IDMEF-Message version="1.0"
                     xmlns:idmef="http://iana.org/idmef"/>

IDMEF-compliant applications MAY choose to omit the XML declaration internally to conserve space, adding it only when the message is sent to another destination (e.g., a web browser). This practice is NOT RECOMMENDED unless it can be accomplished without loss of each message's version and encoding information.
contents.zh-CHS: 符合IDMEF的应用程序可能会选择在内部省略XML声明以节省空间，仅当消息发送到另一个目的地（例如，web浏览器）时才添加它。除非可以在不丢失每条消息的版本和编码信息的情况下完成此操作，否则不建议使用此操作。

contents.text: In order to be valid (see Section 6.1), an XML document must contain a document type definition. However, this represents significant overhead to an IDMEF-compliant application, both in the bandwidth it consumes as well as the requirements it places on the XML processor (not only to parse the declaration itself, but also to parse the DTD it references).
contents.zh-CHS: 为了有效（参见第6.1节），XML文档必须包含文档类型定义。然而，这对符合IDMEF的应用程序来说意味着巨大的开销，包括它所消耗的带宽以及它对XML处理器的要求（不仅解析声明本身，还解析它引用的DTD）。

contents.text: Implementors MAY decide, therefore, to have analyzers and managers agree out-of-band on the particular document type definition they will be using to exchange messages (the standard one as defined here, or one with extensions), and then omit the document type definition from IDMEF messages. The method for negotiating this agreement is outside the scope of this document. Note that great care must be taken in negotiating any such agreements, as the manager may have to accept messages from many different analyzers, each using a DTD with a different set of extensions.
contents.zh-CHS: 因此，实现者可能会决定让分析人员和管理人员就他们将用于交换消息的特定文档类型定义（此处定义的标准文档类型定义，或具有扩展名的文档类型定义）达成带外协议，然后从IDMEF消息中省略文档类型定义。协商本协议的方法不在本文件范围内。请注意，在协商任何此类协议时必须非常小心，因为经理可能必须接受来自许多不同分析器的消息，每个分析器使用具有不同扩展集的DTD。

contents.text: 3.1.2. Character Data Processing in IDMEF
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.2. IDMEF中的字符数据处理

contents.text: For portability reasons, IDMEF-compliant applications SHOULD NOT use, and IDMEF messages SHOULD NOT be encoded in, character encodings other than UTF-8 and UTF-16. Consistent with the XML standard, if no encoding is specified for an IDMEF message, UTF-8 is assumed.
contents.zh-CHS: 出于可移植性的原因，符合IDMEF的应用程序不应使用UTF-8和UTF-16以外的字符编码，也不应使用IDMEF消息编码。与XML标准一致，如果没有为IDMEF消息指定编码，则假定为UTF-8。

contents.text: NOTE: The ASCII character set is a subset of the UTF-8 encoding, and therefore may be used to encode IDMEF messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：ASCII字符集是UTF-8编码的子集，因此可用于编码IDMEF消息。

contents.text: Per the XML standard, IDMEF documents encoded in UTF-16 MUST begin with the Byte Order Mark described by ISO/IEC 10646 Annex E and Unicode Appendix B (the "ZERO WIDTH NO-BREAK SPACE" character, #xFEFF).
contents.zh-CHS: 根据XML标准，以UTF-16编码的IDMEF文档必须以ISO/IEC 10646附录E和Unicode附录B中描述的字节顺序标记开头（“零宽度无中断空间”字符#xFEFF）。

contents.text: 3.1.2.1. Character Entity References
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.2.1. 字符实体引用

contents.text: It is RECOMMENDED that IDMEF-compliant applications use the entity reference form (see Section 3.2.3.1) of the characters '&', ,'<', '>', '"', and ''' (single-quote) whenever writing these characters in data, to avoid any possibility of misinterpretation.
contents.zh-CHS: 建议符合IDMEF的应用程序在将这些字符写入数据时使用字符“&”、“<”、“>”、““”和“”（单引号）的实体引用形式（见第3.2.3.1节），以避免任何误解的可能性。

contents.text: 3.1.2.2. White Space Processing
All IDMEF elements MUST support the "xml:space" attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 所有IDMEF元素都必须支持“xml:space”属性。

contents.text: 3.1.3. Languages in IDMEF
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1.3. IDMEF中的语言

contents.text: IDMEF-compliant applications MUST specify the language in which their contents are encoded; in general this can be done by specifying the "xml:lang" attribute for the top-level element and letting all other elements "inherit" that definition [10].
contents.zh-CHS: 符合IDMEF的应用程序必须指定其内容的编码语言；通常，这可以通过为顶级元素指定“xml:lang”属性并让所有其他元素“继承”该定义来实现[10]。

contents.text: 3.2. IDMEF Data Types
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2. IDMEF数据类型

contents.text: Within an XML IDMEF message, all data will be expressed as "text" (as opposed to "binary"), since XML is a text formatting language. We provide typing information for the attributes of the classes in the data model, however, to convey to the reader the type of data that the model expects for each attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 在XMLIDMEF消息中，所有数据都将表示为“文本”（而不是“二进制”），因为XML是一种文本格式语言。但是，我们为数据模型中的类的属性提供类型信息，以便向读者传达模型对每个属性所期望的数据类型。

contents.text: Each data type in the model has specific formatting requirements in an XML IDMEF message; these requirements are set forth in this section.
contents.zh-CHS: 模型中的每个数据类型在XML IDMEF消息中都有特定的格式要求；本节规定了这些要求。

contents.text: 3.2.1. Integers
Integer attributes are represented by the INTEGER data type. Integer data MUST be encoded in Base 10 or Base 16.
contents.zh-CHS: 整数属性由整数数据类型表示。整数数据必须以10或16为基数进行编码。

contents.text: Base 10 integer encoding uses the digits '0' through '9' and an optional sign ('+' or '-'). For example, "123", "-456".
Base 16 integer encoding uses the digits '0' through '9' and 'a' through 'f' (or their uppercase equivalents), and is preceded by the characters "0x". For example, "0x1a2b".
contents.zh-CHS: 基16整数编码使用数字“0”到“9”和“a”到“f”（或其大写等效形式），前面是字符“0x”。例如，“0x1a2b”。

contents.text: 3.2.2. Real Numbers
Real (floating-point) attributes are represented by the REAL data type. Real data MUST be encoded in Base 10.
contents.zh-CHS: 实数（浮点）属性由实数数据类型表示。实际数据必须以10为基数进行编码。

contents.text: Real encoding is that of the POSIX 1003.1 "strtod" library function: an optional sign ('+' or '-') followed by a non-empty string of decimal digits, optionally containing a radix character, then an optional exponent part. An exponent part consists of an 'e' or 'E', followed by an optional sign, followed by one or more decimal digits. For example, "123.45e02", "-567,89e-03".
contents.zh-CHS: 实编码是POSIX 1003.1“strtod”库函数的编码：可选符号（“+”或“-”）后跟十进制数字的非空字符串，可选包含基数字符，然后是可选的指数部分。指数部分由“e”或“e”组成，后跟可选符号，后跟一个或多个十进制数字。例如，“123.45e02”、“-567,89e-03”。

contents.text: IDMEF-compliant applications MUST support both the '.' and ',' radix characters.
contents.zh-CHS: 符合IDMEF的应用程序必须同时支持“.”和“，”基数字符。

contents.text: 3.2.3. Characters and Strings
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.3. 字符和字符串

contents.text: Single-character attributes are represented by the CHARACTER data type. Multi-character attributes of known length are represented by the STRING data type.
contents.zh-CHS: 单个字符属性由字符数据类型表示。已知长度的多字符属性由字符串数据类型表示。

contents.text: Character and string data have no special formatting requirements, other than the need to occasionally use character references (see Section 3.2.3.1 and Section 3.2.3.2) to represent special characters.
contents.zh-CHS: 除了偶尔需要使用字符引用（见第3.2.3.1节和第3.2.3.2节）来表示特殊字符外，字符和字符串数据没有特殊的格式要求。

contents.text: 3.2.3.1. Character Entity References
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.3.1. 字符实体引用

contents.text: Within XML documents, certain characters have special meanings in some contexts. To include the actual character itself in one of these contexts, a special escape sequence, called an entity reference, must be used.
contents.zh-CHS: 在XML文档中，某些字符在某些上下文中具有特殊含义。要将实际字符本身包含在其中一个上下文中，必须使用称为实体引用的特殊转义序列。

contents.text: The characters that sometimes need to be escaped, and their entity references, are:
contents.zh-CHS: 有时需要转义的字符及其实体引用包括：

contents.text: 3.2.3.2. Character Code References
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.3.2. 字符代码引用

contents.text: Any character defined by the ISO/IEC 10646 and Unicode standards may be included in an XML document by the use of a character reference. A character reference is started with the characters '&' and '#', and ended with the character ';'. Between these characters, the character code for the character is inserted.
contents.zh-CHS: 通过使用字符引用，可将ISO/IEC 10646和Unicode标准定义的任何字符包括在XML文档中。字符引用以字符“&”和“#”开头，以字符“；”结尾。在这些字符之间插入字符的字符代码。

contents.text: If the character code is preceded by an 'x' it is interpreted in hexadecimal (base 16); otherwise, it is interpreted in decimal (base 10). For instance, the ampersand (&) is encoded as & or & and the less-than sign (<) is encoded as < or <.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果字符代码前面有一个“x”，则以十六进制（以16为基数）进行解释；否则，将以十进制（以10为基数）进行解释。例如，符号（&）被编码为&#38；或&#x0026；小于号（<）编码为&#60；或&#x003C；。

contents.text: Any one-, two-, or four-byte character specified in the ISO/IEC 10646 and Unicode standards can be included in a document using this technique.
contents.zh-CHS: 使用此技术，ISO/IEC 10646和Unicode标准中指定的任何一个、两个或四个字节的字符都可以包含在文档中。

contents.text: 3.2.4. Bytes
Binary data is represented by the BYTE (and BYTE[]) data type.
contents.zh-CHS: 二进制数据由字节（和字节[]）数据类型表示。

contents.text: Binary data MUST be encoded in its entirety using base64.
contents.zh-CHS: 必须使用base64对二进制数据进行整体编码。

contents.text: 3.2.5. Enumerated Types
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.5. 枚举类型

contents.text: Enumerated types are represented by the ENUM data type, and consist of an ordered list of acceptable values.
contents.zh-CHS: 枚举类型由枚举数据类型表示，并由可接受值的有序列表组成。

contents.text: 3.2.6. Date-Time Strings
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.6. 日期时间字符串

contents.text: Date-time strings are represented by the DATETIME data type. Each date-time string identifies a particular instant in time; ranges are not supported.
contents.zh-CHS: 日期时间字符串由日期时间数据类型表示。每个日期时间字符串标识特定的时间瞬间；不支持范围。

contents.text: Date-time strings are formatted according to a subset of ISO 8601: 2000 [6], as show below. Section references in parentheses refer to sections of the ISO 8601:2000 standard [6].
contents.zh-CHS: 日期时间字符串按照ISO 8601:2000[6]的子集进行格式化，如下所示。括号中的章节参考参考ISO 8601:2000标准[6]的章节。

contents.text: 1. Dates MUST be formatted as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 日期的格式必须如下所示：

contents.text: YYYY-MM-DD
contents.zh-CHS: YYYY-MM-DD

contents.text: where YYYY is the four-digit year, MM is the two-digit month (01-12), and DD is the two-digit day (01-31). (Section 5.2.1.1, "Complete representation -- Extended format".)
contents.zh-CHS: 其中，YYYY是四位数的年份，MM是两位数的月份（01-12），DD是两位数的日期（01-31）。（第5.2.1.1节，“完整表示——扩展格式”。）

contents.text: 2. Times MUST be formatted as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 时间的格式必须如下所示：

contents.text: hh:mm:ss
contents.zh-CHS: hh:mm:ss

contents.text: where hh is the two-digit hour (00-24), mm is the two-digit minute (00-59), and ss is the two-digit second (00-60). (Section 5.3.1.1, "Complete representation -- Extended format".)
contents.zh-CHS: 其中hh是两位数的小时（00-24），mm是两位数的分钟（00-59），ss是两位数的秒（00-60）。（第5.3.1.1节，“完整表示——扩展格式”。）

contents.text: Note that midnight has two representations, 00:00:00 and 24:00:00. Both representations MUST be supported by IDMEF-compliant applications; however, the 00:00:00 representation SHOULD be used whenever possible.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，午夜有两种表示形式，00:00:00和24:00:00。这两种表述必须得到IDMEF兼容应用程序的支持；但是，应尽可能使用00:00:00表示。

contents.text: Note also that this format accounts for leap seconds. Positive leap seconds are inserted between 23:59:59Z and 24:00:00Z and are represented as 23:59:60Z. Negative leap seconds are achieved by the omission of 23:59:59Z. IDMEF-compliant applications MUST support leap seconds.
contents.zh-CHS: 还请注意，此格式用于闰秒。正闰秒插入在23:59:59Z和24:00:00Z之间，表示为23:59:60Z。通过省略23:59:59Z实现负闰秒。符合IDMEF的应用程序必须支持闰秒。

contents.text: 3. Times MAY be formatted to include a decimal fraction of seconds, as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 时间的格式可以包括秒的小数部分，如下所示：

contents.text:
hh:mm:ss.ss or
hh:mm:ss,ss

As many digits as necessary may follow the decimal sign (at least one digit must follow the decimal sign). Decimal fractions of hours and minutes are not supported. (Section 5.3.1.3, "Representation of decimal fractions".)
contents.zh-CHS: 小数点后可以有尽可能多的数字（小数点后必须至少有一个数字）。不支持小时和分钟的小数。（第5.3.1.3节，“小数点的表示”。）

contents.text: IDMEF-compliant applications MUST support the use of both decimal signs ('.' and ',').
contents.zh-CHS: 符合IDMEF的应用程序必须支持使用十进制符号（“.”和“，”）。

contents.text: Note that the number of digits in the fraction part does not imply anything about accuracy -- i.e., "00.100000", "00,1000", and "00.1" are all equivalent.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，分数部分中的位数并不意味着与精度有关的任何内容，即“00.100000”、“001000”和“00.1”都是等效的。

contents.text: 4. Times MUST be formatted to include (a) an indication that the time is in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or (b) an indication of the difference between the specified time and Coordinated Universal Time.
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 时间的格式必须包括（a）表示时间为协调世界时（UTC）或（b）表示指定时间与协调世界时之间的差异。

contents.text: * Times in UTC MUST be formatted by appending the letter 'Z' to the time string as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: * UTC时间的格式必须通过在时间字符串后添加字母“Z”，如下所示：

contents.text:
hh:mm:ssZ
hh:mm:ss.ssZ
hh:mm:ss,ssZ
(Section 5.3.3, "Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) -- Extended format".)
contents.zh-CHS: （第5.3.3节，“协调世界时（UTC）-扩展格式”。）

contents.text: * If the time is ahead of or equal to UTC, a '+' sign is appended to the time string; if the time is behind UTC, a '-' sign is appended. Following the sign, the number of hours and minutes representing the different from UTC is appended, as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: * 如果时间早于或等于UTC，则在时间字符串后附加“+”号；如果时间晚于UTC，则会附加“-”符号。在符号后，附加表示与UTC不同的小时数和分钟数，如下所示：

contents.text:
hh:mm:ss+hh:mm
hh:mm:ss-hh:mm
hh:mm:ss.ss+hh:mm

hh:mm:ss.ss-hh:mm
hh:mm:ss,ss+hh:mm
hh:mm:ss,ss-hh:mm

The difference from UTC MUST be specified in both hours and minutes, even if the minutes component is 0. A "difference" of "+00:00" is equivalent to UTC. (Section 5.3.4.2, "Local time and the difference with Coordinated Universal Time -- Extended Format".)
contents.zh-CHS: 与UTC的差值必须以小时和分钟为单位指定，即使分钟分量为0。“+00:00”的“差”等于UTC。（第5.3.4.2节，“当地时间及其与协调世界时的差异——扩展格式”。）

contents.text: 5. Date-time strings are created by joining the date and time strings with the letter 'T', as shown below:
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 日期时间字符串是通过将日期和时间字符串与字母“T”连接起来创建的，如下所示：

contents.text:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssZ
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss,ssZ
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+hh:mm
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss-hh:mm
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ss+hh:mm
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ss-hh:mm
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss,ss+hh:mm
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss,ss-hh:mm
(Section 5.4.1, "Complete representation -- Extended format".)
contents.zh-CHS: （第5.4.1节，“完整表示——扩展格式”。）

contents.text: In summary, IDMEF date-time strings MUST adhere to one of the nine templates identified in Paragraph 5, above.
contents.zh-CHS: 总之，IDMEF日期时间字符串必须符合上文第5段中确定的九个模板之一。

contents.text: 3.2.7. NTP Timestamps
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.7. NTP时间戳

contents.text: NTP timestamps are represented by the NTPSTAMP data type and are described in detail in [7] and [8]. An NTP timestamp is a 64-bit unsigned fixed-point number. The integer part is in the first 32 bits, and the fraction part is in the last 32 bits.
contents.zh-CHS: NTP时间戳由NTPSTAMP数据类型表示，并在[7]和[8]中详细描述。NTP时间戳是64位无符号定点数字。整数部分在前32位，小数部分在后32位。

contents.text: Within IDMEF messages, NTP timestamps MUST be encoded as two 32-bit hexadecimal values, separated by a period ('.'). For example, "0x12345678.0x87654321".
contents.zh-CHS: 在IDMEF消息中，NTP时间戳必须编码为两个32位十六进制值，用句点（'.'）分隔。例如，“0x12345678.0x87654321”。

contents.text: See also Section 6.4 for more information on NTP timestamps.
contents.zh-CHS: 有关NTP时间戳的更多信息，请参见第6.4节。

contents.text: 3.2.8. Port Lists
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.8. 端口列表

contents.text: Port lists are represented by the PORTLIST data type and consist of a comma-separated list of numbers (individual integers) and ranges (N-M means ports N through M, inclusive). Any combination of numbers and ranges may be used in a single list. For example, "5-25,37,42,43,53,69-119,123-514".
contents.zh-CHS: 端口列表由端口列表数据类型表示，由逗号分隔的数字列表（单个整数）和范围（N-M表示端口N到M，包括在内）组成。可以在单个列表中使用数字和范围的任意组合。例如，“5-25,37,42,43,53,69-119123-514”。

contents.text: 3.2.9. Unique Identifiers
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2.9. 唯一标识符

contents.text: There are two types of unique identifiers used in this specification. Both types are represented by STRING data types.
contents.zh-CHS: 本规范中使用了两种类型的唯一标识符。这两种类型都由字符串数据类型表示。

contents.text: These identifiers are implemented as attributes on the relevant XML elements, and they must have unique values as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这些标识符作为相关XML元素上的属性实现，它们必须具有唯一值，如下所示：

contents.text: 1. The Analyzer class' (Section 4.2.4.1) "analyzerid" attribute, if specified, MUST have a value that is unique across all analyzers in the intrusion detection environment.
contents.zh-CHS: 1. Analyzer class”（第4.2.4.1节）“analyzerid”属性（如果指定）的值必须在入侵检测环境中的所有分析仪中唯一。

contents.text: The "analyzerid" attribute is not required to be globally unique, only unique within the intrusion detection environment of which the analyzer is a member. It is permissible for two analyzers, in different intrusion detection environments, to have the same value for "analyzerid".
contents.zh-CHS: “analyzerid”属性不要求全局唯一，仅在analyzer所属的入侵检测环境中唯一。在不同的入侵检测环境中，允许两个分析器具有相同的“analyzerid”值。

contents.text: The default value is "0", which indicates that the analyzer cannot generate unique identifiers.
contents.zh-CHS: 默认值为“0”，表示分析器无法生成唯一标识符。

contents.text: 2. The Alert and Heartbeat messages (Sections 4.2.2, 4.2.3) must be uniquely identified by the couple (analyzerid,messageid), if the analyzer supports the generation of message identifiers.
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 如果分析仪支持生成消息标识符，则警报和心跳消息（第4.2.2节、第4.2.3节）必须由该对（analyzerid、messageid）唯一标识。

contents.text: 3. The Classification, Source, Target, Node, User, Process, Service, File, Address, and UserId classes' (Sections 4.2.4.2, 4.2.4.3, 4.2.4.4, 4.2.7.2, 4.2.7.3, 4.2.7.4, 4.2.7.5, 4.2.7.6, 4.2.7.2.1, and 4.2.7.3.1) "ident" attribute, if specified, MUST have a value that is unique across all messages sent by the individual analyzer.
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 分类、源、目标、节点、用户、流程、服务、文件、地址和用户标识类”（第4.2.4.2节、第4.2.4.3节、第4.2.4.4节、第4.2.7.2节、第4.2.7.3节、第4.2.7.4节、第4.2.7.5节、第4.2.7.6节、第4.2.7.1节和第4.2.7.3.1节）“ident”属性（如有规定）的值必须在单个分析仪发送的所有消息中唯一。

contents.text: The "ident" attribute value MUST be unique for each particular combination of data identifying an object, not for each object. Objects may have more than one "ident" value associated with them. For example, an identification of a host by name would have one value, while an identification of that host by address would have another value, and an identification of that host by both name and address would have still another value. Furthermore, different analyzers may produce different values for the same information.
contents.zh-CHS: 对于标识对象的每个特定数据组合，“ident”属性值必须是唯一的，而不是每个对象。对象可能有多个与之关联的“ident”值。例如，按名称对主机的标识将有一个值，而按地址对该主机的标识将有另一个值，而按名称和地址对该主机的标识将还有另一个值。此外，对于相同的信息，不同的分析仪可能会产生不同的值。

contents.text: The "ident" attribute by itself provides a unique identifier only among all the "ident" values sent by a particular analyzer. But when combined with the "analyzerid" value for the analyzer, a value that is unique across the intrusion detection environment is created. Again, there is no requirement for global uniqueness.
contents.zh-CHS: “ident”属性本身仅在特定分析器发送的所有“ident”值中提供唯一标识符。但是，当与分析器的“analyzerid”值结合使用时，会创建一个在整个入侵检测环境中唯一的值。同样，不需要全局唯一性。

contents.text: The default value is "0", which indicates that the analyzer cannot generate unique identifiers.
contents.zh-CHS: 默认值为“0”，表示分析器无法生成唯一标识符。

contents.text: The specification of methods for creating the unique values contained in these attributes is outside the scope of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 创建这些属性中包含的唯一值的方法规范不在本文档的范围内。

contents.text: 4. The IDMEF Data Model and DTD
contents.zh-CHS: 4. IDMEF数据模型与DTD

contents.text: In this section, the individual components of the IDMEF data model are explained in detail. Unified Modeling Language (UML) diagrams of the model are provided to show how the components are related to each other, and relevant sections of the IDMEF DTD are presented to show how the model is translated into XML.
contents.zh-CHS: 在本节中，将详细说明IDMEF数据模型的各个组件。提供了模型的统一建模语言（UML）图，以显示组件之间的相互关系，并提供了IDMEF DTD的相关部分，以显示如何将模型转换为XML。

contents.text: 4.1. Data Model Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 4.1. 数据模型概述

contents.text: The relationship between the principal components of the data model is shown in Figure 1 (occurrence indicators and attributes are omitted).
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型的主要组件之间的关系如图1所示（省略了发生指标和属性）。

contents.text: The top-level class for all IDMEF messages is IDMEF-Message; each type of message is a subclass of this top-level class. There are presently two types of messages defined: Alerts and Heartbeats. Within each message, subclasses of the message class are used to provide the detailed information carried in the message.
contents.zh-CHS: 所有IDMEF消息的顶级类都是IDMEF消息；每种类型的消息都是这个顶级类的一个子类。目前定义了两种类型的消息：警报和心跳。在每个消息中，消息类的子类用于提供消息中包含的详细信息。

contents.text: It is important to note that the data model does not specify how an alert should be classified or identified. For example, a port scan may be identified by one analyzer as a single attack against multiple targets, while another analyzer might identify it as multiple attacks from a single source. However, once an analyzer has determined the type of alert it plans to send, the data model dictates how that alert should be formatted.
contents.zh-CHS: 需要注意的是，数据模型没有指定警报应如何分类或识别。例如，一台分析仪可能会将端口扫描识别为针对多个目标的单一攻击，而另一台分析仪可能会将其识别为来自单一来源的多个攻击。但是，一旦分析仪确定了其计划发送的警报类型，数据模型将指示该警报的格式。

contents.text: Figure 1: Data Model Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 图1：数据模型概述

contents.text: 4.2. The Message Classes
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2. 消息类

contents.text: The individual classes are described in the following sections.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下各节介绍了各个类。

contents.text: 4.2.1. The IDMEF-Message Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.1. IDMEF消息类

contents.text: All IDMEF messages are instances of the IDMEF-Message class; it is the top-level class of the IDMEF data model, as well as the IDMEF DTD. There are currently two types (subclasses) of IDMEF-Message: Alert and Heartbeat.
contents.zh-CHS: 所有IDMEF消息都是IDMEF消息类的实例；它是IDMEF数据模型以及IDMEF DTD的顶级类。IDMEF消息目前有两种类型（子类）：警报和心跳。

contents.text: The IDMEF-Message class has a single attribute:
contents.zh-CHS: IDMEF消息类只有一个属性：

contents.text: version
contents.zh-CHS: 版本

contents.text: The version of the IDMEF-Message specification (this document) this message conforms to. Applications specifying a value for this attribute MUST specify the value "1.0".
contents.zh-CHS: 此消息符合的IDMEF消息规范（本文档）版本。为该属性指定值的应用程序必须指定值“1.0”。

contents.text: 4.2.2. The Alert Class

Generally, every time an analyzer detects an event that it has been configured to look for, it sends an Alert message to its manager(s). Depending on the analyzer, an Alert message may correspond to a single detected event or multiple detected events. Alerts occur asynchronously in response to outside events.
contents.zh-CHS: 通常，每次分析仪检测到其配置为查找的事件时，都会向其管理器发送警报消息。根据分析仪的不同，警报消息可能对应于单个检测到的事件或多个检测到的事件。警报以异步方式响应外部事件。

contents.text: An Alert message is composed of several aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 2. The aggregate classes themselves are described in Section 4.2.4, Section 4.2.5, and Section 4.2.6.
contents.zh-CHS: 警报消息由几个聚合类组成，如图2所示。第4.2.4节、第4.2.5节和第4.2.6节描述了骨料类别本身。

contents.text: Figure 2: The Alert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图2：警报类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up Alert are:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成警报的聚合类包括：

contents.text: Analyzer
contents.zh-CHS: 分析器

contents.text: Exactly one. Identification information for the analyzer that originated the alert.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。发出警报的分析仪的标识信息。

contents.text: CreateTime
contents.zh-CHS: 创建时间

contents.text: Exactly one. The time the alert was created. Of the three times that may be provided with an Alert, this is the only one that is required.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。创建警报的时间。在三次警报中，这是唯一需要的一次。

contents.text: Classification
contents.zh-CHS: 分类

contents.text: Exactly one. The "name" of the alert, or other information allowing the manager to determine what it is.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。警报的“名称”，或允许管理员确定警报内容的其他信息。

contents.text: DetectTime
contents.zh-CHS: 探测时间

contents.text: Zero or one. The time the event(s) leading up to the alert was detected. In the case of more than one event, the time the first event was detected. In some circumstances, this may not be the same value as CreateTime.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。检测到导致警报的事件的时间。如果发生多个事件，则为检测到第一个事件的时间。在某些情况下，这可能与CreateTime的值不同。

contents.text: AnalyzerTime
contents.zh-CHS: 分析时间

contents.text: Zero or one. The current time on the analyzer (see Section 6.3).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。分析仪上的当前时间（见第6.3节）。

contents.text: Source
contents.zh-CHS: 来源

contents.text: Zero or more. The source(s) of the event(s) leading up to the alert.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或更多。导致警报的事件源。

contents.text: Target
contents.zh-CHS: 目标

contents.text: Zero or more. The target(s) of the event(s) leading up to the alert.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或更多。导致警报的事件的目标。

contents.text: Assessment
contents.zh-CHS: 看法

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the impact of the event, actions taken by the analyzer in response to it, and the analyzer's confidence in its evaluation.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关事件影响的信息、分析仪针对事件采取的措施以及分析仪对其评估的信心。

contents.text: AdditionalData
contents.zh-CHS: 附加数据

contents.text: Zero or more. Information included by the analyzer that does not fit into the data model. This may be an atomic piece of data, or a large amount of data provided through an extension to the IDMEF (see Section 5).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或更多。分析器包含的不适合数据模型的信息。这可能是一段原子数据，也可能是通过IDMEF扩展提供的大量数据（参见第5节）。

contents.text: Alert is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 警报在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT Alert ( Analyzer, CreateTime, DetectTime?, AnalyzerTime?, Source*, Target*, Classification, Assessment?, (ToolAlert | OverflowAlert | CorrelationAlert)?, AdditionalData* )> <!ATTLIST Alert messageid CDATA '0' %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素警报（Analyzer，CreateTime，DetectTime？，AnalyzerTime？，源*，目标*，分类，评估？，（ToolAlert | OverflowAlert | CorrelationAlert）？，附加数据*）><！ATTLIST警报消息ID CDATA“0”%ATTLIST.global；>

contents.text: The Alert class has one attribute:
contents.zh-CHS: 警报类有一个属性：

contents.text: messageid
contents.zh-CHS: 消息ID

contents.text: Optional. A unique identifier for the alert; see Section 3.2.9.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的警报的唯一标识符；见第3.2.9节。

contents.text: 4.2.2.1. The ToolAlert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.2.1. ToolAlert类

contents.text: The ToolAlert class carries additional information related to the use of attack tools or malevolent programs such as Trojan horses and can be used by the analyzer when it is able to identify these tools. It is intended to group one or more previously-sent alerts together, to say "these alerts were all the result of someone using this tool".
contents.zh-CHS: ToolAlert类包含与攻击工具或恶意程序（如特洛伊木马）的使用相关的附加信息，分析仪可以在识别这些工具时使用这些信息。它旨在将一个或多个以前发送的警报组合在一起，表示“这些警报都是某人使用此工具的结果”。

contents.text: The ToolAlert class is composed of three aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 3.
contents.zh-CHS: ToolAlert类由三个聚合类组成，如图3所示。

contents.text: Figure 3: The ToolAlert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图3:ToolAlert类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up ToolAlert are:
contents.zh-CHS: 组成ToolAlert的聚合类包括：

contents.text: name
contents.zh-CHS: 名称

contents.text: Exactly one. STRING. The reason for grouping the alerts together, for example, the name of a particular tool.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。一串将警报分组在一起的原因，例如，特定工具的名称。

contents.text: command
contents.zh-CHS: 命令

contents.text: Zero or one. STRING. The command or operation that the tool was asked to perform, for example, a BackOrifice ping.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。一串要求刀具执行的命令或操作，例如，反向孔板ping。

contents.text: alertident
contents.zh-CHS: 警报识别

contents.text: One or more. STRING. The list of alert identifiers that are related to this alert. Because alert identifiers are only unique across the alerts sent by a single analyzer, the optional "analyzerid" attribute of "alertident" should be used to identify the analyzer that a particular alert came from. If the "analyzerid" is not provided, the alert is assumed to have come from the same analyzer that is sending the ToolAlert.
contents.zh-CHS: 一个或多个。一串与此警报相关的警报标识符列表。由于警报标识符仅在单个分析仪发送的警报中是唯一的，“AlertIdentit”的可选“analyzerid”属性应用于标识特定警报来自的分析仪。如果未提供“analyzerid”，则假定警报来自发送ToolAlert的同一分析仪。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT ToolAlert                     (
    name, command?, alertident+
  )>
<!ATTLIST ToolAlert
    %attlist.global;
  >
4.2.2.2. The CorrelationAlert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.2.2. CorrelationAlert类

contents.text: The CorrelationAlert class carries additional information related to the correlation of alert information. It is intended to group one or more previously-sent alerts together, to say "these alerts are all related".
contents.zh-CHS: CorrelationAlert类包含与警报信息相关性相关的附加信息。它旨在将一个或多个以前发送的警报组合在一起，表示“这些警报都是相关的”。

contents.text: The CorrelationAlert class is composed of two aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 4.
contents.zh-CHS: CorrelationAlert类由两个聚合类组成，如图4所示。

contents.text: Figure 4: The CorrelationAlert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图4:CorrelationAlert类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up CorrelationAlert are:
contents.zh-CHS: 组成CorrelationAlert的聚合类包括：

contents.text: name
contents.zh-CHS: 名称

contents.text: Exactly one. STRING. The reason for grouping the alerts together, for example, a particular correlation method.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。一串将警报分组在一起的原因，例如，特定的关联方法。

contents.text: alertident
contents.zh-CHS: 警报识别

contents.text: One or more. STRING. The list of alert identifiers that are related to this alert. Because alert identifiers are only unique across the alerts sent by a single analyzer, the optional "analyzerid" attribute of "alertident" should be used to identify the analyzer that a particular alert came from. If the "analyzerid" is not provided, the alert is assumed to have come from the same analyzer that is sending the CorrelationAlert.
contents.zh-CHS: 一个或多个。一串与此警报相关的警报标识符列表。由于警报标识符仅在单个分析仪发送的警报中是唯一的，“AlertIdentit”的可选“analyzerid”属性应用于标识特定警报来自的分析仪。如果未提供“analyzerid”，则假定警报来自发送CorrelationAlert的同一分析仪。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下。

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT CorrelationAlert              (
    name, alertident+
  )>
<!ATTLIST CorrelationAlert
    %attlist.global;
  >
4.2.2.3. The OverflowAlert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.2.3. OverflowAlert类

contents.text: The OverflowAlert carries additional information related to buffer overflow attacks. It is intended to enable an analyzer to provide the details of the overflow attack itself.
contents.zh-CHS: OverflowAlert包含与缓冲区溢出攻击相关的附加信息。它旨在使分析器能够提供溢出攻击本身的详细信息。

contents.text: The OverflowAlert class is composed of three aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 5.
contents.zh-CHS: OverflowAlert类由三个聚合类组成，如图5所示。

contents.text: Figure 5: The OverflowAlert Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图5:OverflowAlert类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up OverflowAlert are:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成OverflowAlert的聚合类包括：

contents.text: program
contents.zh-CHS: 程序

contents.text: Exactly one. STRING. The program that the overflow attack attempted to run (NOTE: this is not the program that was attacked).
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。一串溢出攻击试图运行的程序（注意：这不是被攻击的程序）。

contents.text: size
contents.zh-CHS: 大小

contents.text: Zero or one. INTEGER. The size, in bytes, of the overflow (i.e., the number of bytes the attacker sent).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。整数溢出的大小（以字节为单位）（即攻击者发送的字节数）。

contents.text: buffer
contents.zh-CHS: 缓冲器

contents.text: Zero or one. BYTE[]. Some or all of the overflow data itself (dependent on how much the analyzer can capture).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。字节[]。部分或全部溢出数据本身（取决于分析器可以捕获的数据量）。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT OverflowAlert ( program, size?, buffer? )> <!ATTLIST OverflowAlert %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素溢出警报（程序、大小、缓冲区？>）！ATTLIST溢出警报%ATTLIST.global；>

contents.text: 4.2.3. The Heartbeat Class

Analyzers use Heartbeat messages to indicate their current status to managers. Heartbeats are intended to be sent in a regular period, say, every ten minutes or every hour. The receipt of a Heartbeat message from an analyzer indicates to the manager that the analyzer is up and running; lack of a Heartbeat message (or more likely, lack of some number of consecutive Heartbeat messages) indicates that the analyzer or its network connection has failed.
contents.zh-CHS: 分析器使用心跳消息向管理员指示其当前状态。心跳是按一定的周期发送的，比如说，每十分钟或每小时发送一次。从分析仪接收到心跳消息，向管理器表明分析仪已启动并正在运行；缺少心跳消息（或者更可能的是，缺少一些连续的心跳消息）表示分析仪或其网络连接失败。

contents.text: All managers MUST support the receipt of Heartbeat messages; however, the use of these messages by analyzers is OPTIONAL. Developers of manager software SHOULD permit the software to be configured on a per-analyzer basis to use/not use Heartbeat messages.
contents.zh-CHS: 所有经理必须支持接收心跳消息；但是，分析器使用这些消息是可选的。manager软件的开发人员应允许在每个分析器的基础上配置软件，以使用/不使用心跳消息。

contents.text: A Heartbeat message is composed of several aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 6. The aggregate classes themselves are described in Sections 4.2.4 and 4.2.5.
contents.zh-CHS: 心跳消息由几个聚合类组成，如图6所示。第4.2.4节和第4.2.5节描述了骨料类别本身。

contents.text: Figure 6: The Heartbeat Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图6:Heartbeat类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up Heartbeat are:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成Heartbeat的聚合类有：

contents.text: Analyzer
contents.zh-CHS: 分析器

contents.text: Exactly one. Identification information for the analyzer that originated the heartbeat.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。发起心跳信号的分析器的标识信息。

contents.text: CreateTime
contents.zh-CHS: 创建时间

contents.text: Exactly one. The time the heartbeat was created.
contents.zh-CHS: 正好一个。创建心跳的时间。

contents.text: HeartbeatInterval
contents.zh-CHS: 心跳间隔

contents.text: Zero or one. The interval in seconds at which heartbeats are generated.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。产生心跳的间隔（秒）。

contents.text: AnalyzerTime
contents.zh-CHS: 分析时间

contents.text: Zero or one. The current time on the analyzer (see Section 6.3).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。分析仪上的当前时间（见第6.3节）。

contents.text: AdditionalData
contents.zh-CHS: 附加数据

contents.text: Zero or more. Information included by the analyzer that does not fit into the data model. This may be an atomic piece of data or a large amount of data provided through an extension to the IDMEF (see Section 5).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或更多。分析器包含的不适合数据模型的信息。这可能是一段原子数据，也可能是通过IDMEF的扩展提供的大量数据（参见第5节）。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT Heartbeat ( Analyzer, CreateTime, HeartbeatInterval?, AnalyzerTime?, AdditionalData* )> <!ATTLIST Heartbeat messageid CDATA '0' %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素心跳（Analyzer、CreateTime、HeartbeatInterval？、AnalyzerTime？、附加数据*）><！ATTLIST心跳消息ID CDATA“0”%ATTLIST.global；>

contents.text: The Heartbeat class has one attribute:
contents.zh-CHS: Heartbeat类有一个属性：

contents.text: messageid
contents.zh-CHS: 消息ID

contents.text: Optional. A unique identifier for the heartbeat; see Section 3.2.9.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的心跳信号的唯一标识符；见第3.2.9节。

contents.text: 4.2.4. The Core Classes
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.4. 核心课程

contents.text: The core classes -- Analyzer, Source, Target, Classification, and AdditionalData -- are the main parts of Alerts and Heartbeats, as shown in Figure 7.
contents.zh-CHS: 核心类——Analyzer、Source、Target、Classification和AdditionalData——是警报和心跳的主要部分，如图7所示。

contents.text: Figure 7: The Core Classes
contents.zh-CHS: 图7：核心类

contents.text: 4.2.4.1. The Analyzer Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.4.1. Analyzer类

contents.text: The Analyzer class identifies the analyzer from which the Alert or Heartbeat message originates. Only one analyzer may be encoded for each alert or heartbeat, and that MUST be the analyzer at which the alert or heartbeat originated. Although the IDMEF data model does not prevent the use of hierarchical intrusion detection systems (where alerts get relayed up the tree), it does not provide any way to record the identity of the "relay" analyzers along the path from the originating analyzer to the manager that ultimately receives the alert.
contents.zh-CHS: Analyzer类标识发出警报或心跳消息的分析器。对于每个警报或心跳，只能对一个分析器进行编码，并且该分析器必须是发出警报或心跳的分析器。尽管IDMEF数据模型不阻止使用分层入侵检测系统（警报在树上中继），但它不提供任何方式来记录从原始分析器到最终接收警报的管理器的路径上的“中继”分析器的身份。

contents.text: The Analyzer class is composed of three aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 8.
contents.zh-CHS: Analyzer类由三个聚合类组成，如图8所示。

contents.text: Figure 8: The Analyzer Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图8：Analyzer类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up Analyzer are:
contents.zh-CHS: 组成Analyzer的聚合类包括：

contents.text: Node
contents.zh-CHS: 节点

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the host or device on which the analyzer resides (network address, network name, etc.).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关分析仪所在主机或设备的信息（网络地址、网络名称等）。

contents.text: Process
contents.zh-CHS: 过程

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the process in which the analyzer is executing.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关分析器正在执行的进程的信息。

contents.text: Analyzer
contents.zh-CHS: 分析器

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the analyzer from which the message may have gone through. The idea behind this mechanism is that when a manager receives an alert and wants to forward it to another analyzer, it needs to substitute the original analyzer
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关消息可能已通过的分析器的信息。此机制背后的思想是，当经理收到警报并希望将其转发给另一个分析器时，需要替换原始分析器

contents.text: information with its own. To preserve the original analyzer information, it may be included in the new analyzer definition. This will allow analyzer path tracking.
contents.zh-CHS: 信息本身。为保留原始分析仪信息，可将其包括在新的分析仪定义中。这将允许分析器路径跟踪。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT Analyzer ( Node?, Process?, Analyzer? )> <!ATTLIST Analyzer analyzerid CDATA '0' name CDATA #IMPLIED manufacturer CDATA #IMPLIED model CDATA #IMPLIED version CDATA #IMPLIED class CDATA #IMPLIED ostype CDATA #IMPLIED osversion CDATA #IMPLIED %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素分析器（节点？、过程？、分析器？><！ATTLIST Analyzer Analyzer ID CDATA“0”名称CDATA#隐含制造商CDATA#隐含模型CDATA#隐含版本CDATA#隐含类CDATA#隐含ostype CDATA#隐含osversion CDATA#隐含%ATTLIST.global；>

contents.text: The Analyzer class has eight attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: Analyzer类有八个属性：

contents.text: analyzerid
contents.zh-CHS: 分析器ID

contents.text: Optional (but see below). A unique identifier for the analyzer; see Section 3.2.9.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选（但请参见下文）。分析仪的唯一标识符；见第3.2.9节。

contents.text: This attribute is only "partially" optional. If the analyzer makes use of the "ident" attributes on other classes to provide unique identifiers for those objects, then it MUST also provide a valid "analyzerid" attribute. This requirement is dictated by the uniqueness requirements of the "ident" attribute (they are unique only within the context of a particular "analyzerid"). If the analyzer does not make use of the "ident" attributes, however, it may also omit the "analyzerid" attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 此属性仅“部分”可选。如果分析器利用其他类上的“ident”属性为这些对象提供唯一标识符，那么它还必须提供有效的“analyzerid”属性。此要求由“ident”属性的唯一性要求决定（它们仅在特定“analyzerid”的上下文中是唯一的）。但是，如果分析器没有使用“ident”属性，它也可以省略“analyzerid”属性。

contents.text: name
contents.zh-CHS: 名称

contents.text: Optional. An explicit name for the analyzer that may be easier to understand than the analyzerid.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的分析器的显式名称，可能比analyzerid更容易理解。

contents.text: manufacturer
contents.zh-CHS: 制造商

contents.text: Optional. The manufacturer of the analyzer software and/or hardware.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的分析仪软件和/或硬件的制造商。

contents.text: model
contents.zh-CHS: 模型

contents.text: Optional. The model name/number of the analyzer software and/or hardware.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的分析仪软件和/或硬件的型号名称/编号。

contents.text: version
contents.zh-CHS: 版本

contents.text: Optional. The version number of the analyzer software and/or hardware.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的分析仪软件和/或硬件的版本号。

contents.text: class
contents.zh-CHS: 班

contents.text: Optional. The class of analyzer software and/or hardware.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的分析仪软件和/或硬件的类别。

contents.text: ostype
contents.zh-CHS: ostype

contents.text: Optional. Operating system name. On POSIX 1003.1 compliant systems, this is the value returned in utsname.sysname by the uname() system call, or the output of the "uname -s" command.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的操作系统名称。在符合POSIX 1003.1的系统上，这是uname（）系统调用在utsname.sysname中返回的值，或者是“uname-s”命令的输出。

contents.text: osversion
contents.zh-CHS: 渗透压

contents.text: Optional. Operating system version. On POSIX 1003.1 compliant systems, this is the value returned in utsname.release by the uname() system call, or the output of the "uname -r" command.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的操作系统版本。在符合POSIX 1003.1的系统上，这是uname（）系统调用在utsname.release中返回的值，或者是“uname-r”命令的输出。

contents.text: The "manufacturer", "model", "version", and "class" attributes' contents are vendor-specific, but may be used together to identify different types of analyzers (and perhaps make determinations about the contents to expect in other vendor-specific fields of IDMEF messages).
contents.zh-CHS: “制造商”、“型号”、“版本”和“类别”属性的内容是特定于供应商的，但可一起用于识别不同类型的分析仪（并可能确定IDMEF消息的其他特定于供应商的字段中预期的内容）。

contents.text: 4.2.4.2. The Classification Class
The Classification class provides the "name" of an alert, or other information allowing the manager to determine what it is. This name is chosen by the alert provider.
contents.zh-CHS: 分类类提供警报的“名称”或其他信息，允许管理员确定警报的内容。此名称由警报提供程序选择。

contents.text: The Classification class is composed of one aggregate class, as shown in Figure 9.
contents.zh-CHS: 分类类由一个聚合类组成，如图9所示。

contents.text: Figure 9: The Classification Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图9：分类类别

contents.text: The aggregate class that makes up Classification is:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成分类的聚合类为：

contents.text: Reference
contents.zh-CHS: 参考

contents.text: Zero or more. Information about the message, pointing to external documentation sites, that will provide background information about the alert.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或更多。有关消息的信息，指向外部文档站点，这些站点将提供有关警报的背景信息。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT Classification ( Reference* )> <!ATTLIST Classification ident CDATA '0' text CDATA #REQUIRED >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素分类（参考*）><！ATTLIST分类标识CDATA“0”文本CDATA#必需>

contents.text: The Classification class has two attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 分类类有两个属性：

contents.text: ident
contents.zh-CHS: 识别

contents.text: Optional. A unique identifier for this classification; see Section 3.2.9.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的此分类的唯一标识符；见第3.2.9节。

contents.text: text
contents.zh-CHS: 文本

contents.text: Required. A vendor-provided string identifying the Alert message.
contents.zh-CHS: 必修的。供应商提供的用于标识警报消息的字符串。

contents.text: 4.2.4.3. The Source Class
The Source class contains information about the possible source(s) of the event(s) that generated an alert. An event may have more than one source (e.g., in a distributed denial-of-service attack).
contents.zh-CHS: Source类包含有关生成警报的事件的可能来源的信息。一个事件可能有多个来源（例如，在分布式拒绝服务攻击中）。

contents.text: The Source class is composed of four aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 10.
contents.zh-CHS: 源类由四个聚合类组成，如图10所示。

contents.text: Figure 10: The Source Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图10：源类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up Source are:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成源的聚合类包括：

contents.text: Node
contents.zh-CHS: 节点

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the host or device that appears to be causing the events (network address, network name, etc.).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关可能导致事件的主机或设备的信息（网络地址、网络名称等）。

contents.text: User
contents.zh-CHS: 使用者

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the user that appears to be causing the event(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关似乎导致事件的用户的信息。

contents.text: Process
contents.zh-CHS: 过程

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the process that appears to be causing the event(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关导致事件的进程的信息。

contents.text: Service
contents.zh-CHS: 服务

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the network service involved in the event(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关事件中涉及的网络服务的信息。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT Source ( Node?, User?, Process?, Service? )> <!ATTLIST Source ident CDATA '0' spoofed %attvals.yesno; 'unknown' interface CDATA #IMPLIED %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素源（节点？、用户？、流程？、服务？><！收件人列表源标识CDATA“0”伪造了%attvals.yesno；'未知的“接口CDATA”#隐含%attlist.global；>

contents.text: The Source class has three attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 源类有三个属性：

contents.text: ident
contents.zh-CHS: 识别

contents.text: Optional. A unique identifier for this source; see Section 3.2.9.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的此源的唯一标识符；见第3.2.9节。

contents.text: spoofed
contents.zh-CHS: 欺骗

contents.text: Optional. An indication of whether the source is, as far as the analyzer can determine, a spoofed address used for hiding the real origin of the attack. The permitted values for this attribute are shown below. The default value is "unknown". (See also Section 10.)
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的就分析器所能确定的范围而言，指示源是否是用于隐藏攻击真正来源的伪造地址。此属性的允许值如下所示。默认值为“未知”。（另见第10节。）

contents.text: interface
contents.zh-CHS: 界面

contents.text: Optional. May be used by a network-based analyzer with multiple interfaces to indicate which interface this source was seen on.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的可由具有多个接口的基于网络的分析仪使用，以指示在哪个接口上看到此源。

contents.text: 4.2.4.4. The Target Class
The Target class contains information about the possible target(s) of the event(s) that generated an alert. An event may have more than one target (e.g., in the case of a port sweep).
contents.zh-CHS: Target类包含有关生成警报的事件的可能目标的信息。一个事件可能有多个目标（例如，在端口扫描的情况下）。

contents.text: The Target class is composed of four aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 11.
contents.zh-CHS: 目标类由四个聚合类组成，如图11所示。

contents.text: Figure 11: The Target Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图11：目标类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up Target are:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成目标的聚合类包括：

contents.text: Node
contents.zh-CHS: 节点

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the host or device at which the event(s) (network address, network name, etc.) is being directed.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关事件（网络地址、网络名称等）所指向的主机或设备的信息。

contents.text: User
contents.zh-CHS: 使用者

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the user at which the event(s) is being directed.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关事件指向的用户的信息。

contents.text: Process
contents.zh-CHS: 过程

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the process at which the event(s) is being directed.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关事件所处进程的信息。

contents.text: Service
contents.zh-CHS: 服务

contents.text: Zero or one. Information about the network service involved in the event(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。有关事件中涉及的网络服务的信息。

contents.text: File
contents.zh-CHS: 文件

contents.text: Optional. Information about file(s) involved in the event(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的有关事件中涉及的文件的信息。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text: <!ELEMENT Target ( Node?, User?, Process?, Service?, File* )> <!ATTLIST Target ident CDATA '0' decoy %attvals.yesno; 'unknown' interface CDATA #IMPLIED %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素目标（节点、用户、流程、服务、文件*）><！收件人列表目标标识CDATA“0”诱饵%attvals.yesno；'未知的“接口CDATA”#隐含%attlist.global；>

contents.text: The Target class has three attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: 目标类有三个属性：

contents.text: ident
contents.zh-CHS: 识别

contents.text: Optional. A unique identifier for this target, see Section 3.2.9.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的该目标的唯一标识符，见第3.2.9节。

contents.text: decoy
contents.zh-CHS: 动物

contents.text: Optional. An indication of whether the target is, as far as the analyzer can determine, a decoy. The permitted values for this attribute are shown below. The default value is "unknown". (See also Section 10.)
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的在分析仪能够确定的范围内，目标是否为诱饵的指示。此属性的允许值如下所示。默认值为“未知”。（另见第10节。）

contents.text: interface
contents.zh-CHS: 界面

contents.text: Optional. May be used by a network-based analyzer with multiple interfaces to indicate which interface this target was seen on.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的可由具有多个接口的基于网络的分析仪使用，以指示在哪个接口上看到此目标。

contents.text: 4.2.4.5. The Assessment Class
The Assessment class is used to provide the analyzer's assessment of an event -- its impact, actions taken in response, and confidence.
contents.zh-CHS: 评估类用于提供分析器对事件的评估——事件的影响、响应所采取的措施和可信度。

contents.text: The Assessment class is composed of three aggregate classes, as shown in Figure 12.
contents.zh-CHS: 评估类由三个聚合类组成，如图12所示。

contents.text: Figure 12: The Assessment Class
contents.zh-CHS: 图12：评估类

contents.text: The aggregate classes that make up Assessment are:
contents.zh-CHS: 构成评估的总类包括：

contents.text: Impact
contents.zh-CHS: 影响

contents.text: Zero or one. The analyzer's assessment of the impact of the event on the target(s).
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。分析仪对事件对目标影响的评估。

contents.text: Action
contents.zh-CHS: 行动

contents.text: Zero or more. The action(s) taken by the analyzer in response to the event.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或更多。分析仪响应事件所采取的操作。

contents.text: Confidence
contents.zh-CHS: 信心

contents.text: Zero or one. A measurement of the confidence the analyzer has in its evaluation of the event.
contents.zh-CHS: 零或一。分析仪对事件评估的置信度测量。

contents.text: This is represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 这在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT Assessment                    (
    Impact?, Action*, Confidence?
  )>
<!ATTLIST Assessment
    %attlist.global;
  >
4.2.4.6. The AdditionalData Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.4.6. AdditionalData类

contents.text: The AdditionalData class is used to provide information that cannot be represented by the data model. AdditionalData can be used to provide atomic data (integers, strings, etc.) in cases where only small amounts of additional information need to be sent; it can also be used to extend the data model and the DTD to support the transmission of complex data (such as packet headers). Detailed instructions for extending the data model and the DTD are provided in Section 5.
contents.zh-CHS: AdditionalData类用于提供数据模型无法表示的信息。在只需要发送少量附加信息的情况下，附加数据可用于提供原子数据（整数、字符串等）；它还可用于扩展数据模型和DTD，以支持复杂数据（如数据包头）的传输。第5节提供了扩展数据模型和DTD的详细说明。

contents.text:
+------+-------------+----------------------------------------------+
| Rank | Keyword     | Description                                  |
+------+-------------+----------------------------------------------+
|    0 | boolean     | The element contains a boolean value, i.e.,  |
|      |             | the strings "true" or "false"                |
|      |             |                                              |
|    1 | byte        | The element content is a single 8-bit byte   |
|      |             | (see Section 3.2.4)                          |
|      |             |                                              |
|    2 | character   | The element content is a single character    |
|      |             | (see Section 3.2.3)                          |
|      |             |                                              |
|    3 | date-time   | The element content is a date-time string    |
|      |             | (see Section 3.2.6)                          |
|      |             |                                              |
|    4 | integer     | The element content is an integer (see       |
|      |             | Section 3.2.1)                               |
|      |             |                                              |
|    5 | ntpstamp    | The element content is an NTP timestamp (see |
|      |             | Section 3.2.7)                               |
|      |             |                                              |
|    6 | portlist    | The element content is a list of ports (see  |
|      |             | Section 3.2.8)                               |
|      |             |                                              |
|    7 | real        | The element content is a real number (see    |
|      |             | Section 3.2.2)                               |
|      |             |                                              |
|    8 | string      | The element content is a string (see         |
|      |             | Section 3.2.3)                               |
|      |             |                                              |
|    9 | byte-string | The element is a byte[] (see Section 3.2.4)  |
|      |             |                                              |
|   10 | xmltext     | The element content is XML-tagged data (see  |
|      |             | Section 5.2)                                 |
+------+-------------+----------------------------------------------+
The AdditionalData element is declared in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: AdditionalData元素在IDMEF DTD中声明如下：

contents.text: <!ENTITY % attvals.adtype " ( boolean | byte | character | date-time | integer | ntpstamp | portlist | real | string | byte-string | xmltext ) ">
contents.zh-CHS: <!实体%attvals.adtype“（布尔值|字节|字符|日期时间|整数| ntpstamp |端口列表|实数|字符串|字节字符串| xmltext）>

contents.text: <!ELEMENT AdditionalData ( (boolean | byte | character | date-time | integer | ntpstamp | portlist | real | string | byte-string | xmltext ) )>
contents.zh-CHS: <!元素附加数据（（布尔值|字节|字符|日期时间|整数| ntpstamp |端口列表|实数|字符串|字节字符串| xmltext））>

contents.text: <!ATTLIST AdditionalData type %attvals.adtype; 'string' meaning CDATA #IMPLIED %attlist.global; >
contents.zh-CHS: <!ATTLIST附加数据类型%attvals.adtype；'字符串的含义是CDATA#隐含的%attlist.global；>

contents.text: The AdditionalData class has one attribute:
contents.zh-CHS: AdditionalData类有一个属性：

contents.text: meaning
contents.zh-CHS: 意思

contents.text: Optional. A string describing the meaning of the element content. These values will be vendor/implementation dependent; the method for ensuring that managers understand the strings sent by analyzers is outside the scope of this specification. A list of acceptable meaning keywords is not within the scope of the document, although later versions may undertake to establish such a list.
contents.zh-CHS: 可选择的描述元素内容含义的字符串。这些值将取决于供应商/实施情况；确保管理人员理解分析器发送的字符串的方法不在本规范的范围内。可接受意义关键词列表不在本文件范围内，尽管后续版本可能会建立此类列表。

contents.text: 4.2.5. The Time Classes
The data model provides three classes for representing time. These classes are elements of the Alert and Heartbeat classes.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型提供了三个表示时间的类。这些类是Alert和Heartbeat类的元素。

contents.text: The time classes are represented in the IDMEF DTD as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 时间类在IDMEF DTD中表示如下：

contents.text:
<!ELEMENT ntpstamp          (#PCDATA)         >
<!ATTLIST ntpstamp          %attlist.global;  >

<!ELEMENT CreateTime          (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST CreateTime
    ntpstamp            CDATA                   #REQUIRED
    %attlist.global;
  >

<!ELEMENT DetectTime          (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST DetectTime
    ntpstamp            CDATA                   #REQUIRED
    %attlist.global;
  >

<!ELEMENT AnalyzerTime        (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST AnalyzerTime
    ntpstamp            CDATA                   #REQUIRED
    %attlist.global;
  >
The DATETIME format of the <CreateTime> element content is described in Section 3.2.6.
contents.zh-CHS: <CreateTime>元素内容的日期时间格式如第3.2.6节所述。

contents.text: If the date and time represented by the element content and the NTP timestamp differ (should "never" happen), the value in the NTP timestamp MUST be used.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果元素内容和NTP时间戳表示的日期和时间不同（如果“永不”发生），则必须使用NTP时间戳中的值。

contents.text: 4.2.5.1. The CreateTime Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.5.1. CreateTime类

contents.text: The CreateTime class is used to indicate the date and time the alert or heartbeat was created by the analyzer.
contents.zh-CHS: CreateTime类用于指示分析器创建警报或心跳的日期和时间。

contents.text: 4.2.5.2. The DetectTime Class

The DetectTime class is used to indicate the date and time that the event(s) producing an alert was detected by the analyzer. In the case of more than one event, it is the time that the first event was detected. (This may or may not be the same time as CreateTime; analyzers are not required to send alerts immediately upon detection).
contents.zh-CHS: DetectTime类用于指示分析器检测到产生警报的事件的日期和时间。如果发生多个事件，则是检测到第一个事件的时间。（这可能与CreateTime同时进行，也可能与CreateTime不同时进行；分析仪不需要在检测到时立即发送警报）。

contents.text: 4.2.5.3. The AnalyzerTime Class
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2.5.3. 分析器时间类

contents.text: The AnalyzerTime class is used to indicate the current date and time on the analyzer. Its values should be filled in as late as possible in the message transmission process, ideally immediately before placing the message "on the wire".
contents.zh-CHS: AnalyzerTime类用于指示分析器上的当前日期和时间。其值应在消息传输过程中尽可能晚地填写，最好是在消息“在线”之前立即填写。

contents.text: The use of <AnalyzerTime> to perform rudimentary time synchronization between analyzers and managers is discussed in Section 6.3.
contents.zh-CHS: 第6.3节讨论了使用<AnalyzerTime>在分析器和管理器之间执行基本时间同步。

contents.text: 4.2.6. The Assessment Classes
The data model provides three types of "assessments" that an analyzer can make about an event. These classes are aggregates of the Assessment class.
contents.zh-CHS: 数据模型提供了分析器可以对事件进行的三种类型的“评估”。这些类是评估类的集合。

contents.text: 4.2.6.1. The Impact Class
